page.title: 01Gauscavaig Bay Tor and Loch
page.content:
The above aea has a very varied type of land cover. Firstly th area is about two thirds sea, which is at the mouth of the sea, loch Lock Eishort. On the lower quarter is the upper half of the township of Tarskavaig where some of the crofts are still worked, the main crops being hay and potatoes. Although some of the crofts are now partly returning to rushes and bracken. The midle area round Loch Gauscavaig is covered by moorland and heath with rock breaking through in some ares. The area round Gauscavaig Bay mostly surrounded by naturl woodland, mainly birch, hazel Towan and oak.
Around Gauscavaig bay is the small township of Tokavaig where the crofts are little used. The ruins of Dunsgaith Castle are still accessible
